interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Murdoch Mysteries Collection 5-8
Review Date: 2016/10/16
Store: Yannick Bisson  (Actor),     Cal Coons  (Director),     Don McCutcheon  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Mystery & Thrillers
Product Description: ['This award-winning Canadian series follows Detective William Murdoch (Yannick Bisson, Sue Thomas: F.B.Eye) as he solves turn-of-the-century Toronto’s most intriguing mysteries with groundbreaking scientific inventions and revolutionary forensic techniques. Aided by his eager deputy, Constable Crabtree (Jonny Harris, Hatching, Matching & Dispatching); gruff boss, Inspector Brackenreid (Thomas Craig, Where the Heart Is); and feisty coroner Dr. Emily Grace (Georgina Reilly, The L.A. Complex), Murdoch faces off against murderers, thieves, and dangerous criminals. He also continues his on-again, off-again romance with pathologist-turned-psychiatrist Dr. Julia Ogden (Gemini winner Hélène Joy, Durham County).During his investigations, Murdoch encounters the greatest minds of the day, like Sir Arthur Conan Doyle, Thomas Edison, Henry Ford, Winston Churchill, and President Theodore Roosevelt. Guest stars in this collection of Seasons 5-8 include Peter Keleghan (The Newsroom), Patrick McKenna (The Red Green Show), Allan Hawco (Republic of Doyle), Thomas Howes (Downton Abbey), Lisa Faulkner (Murder in Suburbia), and Matthew Bennett (Battlestar Galactica).']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Television, Television/Crime', 'Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Don McCutcheon, Laurie Lynd, Harvey Crossland, Cal Coons, Yannick Bisson', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '18', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 1.45 Pounds', 'Item model number': '35644720', 'Director': 'Cal Coons, Don McCutcheon, Harvey Crossland, Laurie Lynd', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '46 hours and 20 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 2, 2016', 'Actors': 'Yannick Bisson', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Acorn', 'Number of discs': '18'}
Review Text: Great series.. Highly recommended.
Review Title: Good detective story.
Rating: 5.0

The Pied Piper (1942)
Roddy McDowall  (Actor),     Anne Baxter  (Actor),     Irving Pichel  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Format: DVD-R  This title is manufactured on demand using DVD-R, when sold by Amazon.com.  Learn more   What's this?
Movies & TV, Movies
['Englishman Mr Howard is on a fishing holiday in eastern France when the Germans invade in 1940. Setting off to try and get back home he is persuaded to take along the two Cavanaugh children, and as his journey progresses his family keeps growing in size. Once in German-occupied northern France a new problem arises - the risk of being heard speaking English.']
{'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Director': 'Irving Pichel', 'Media Format': 'Black & White, Full length', 'Actors': 'Monty Woolley, Roddy McDowall, Anne Baxter'}
This is a great WWII movie that was very well produced. Monte Woolley was great as the lead. It arrived quicker than promised and was a very good copy.

Against the Sun
Drama, Adventure, Downbeat, Emotional
['In one of the most harrowing true stories of World War II, three US Navy airmen crash land their torpedo bomber in the South Pacific and find themselves on a tiny life raft, surrounded by open ocean. No food. No water. No hope of rescue. Against incredible odds, these three virtual strangers must survive storms, sharks, starvation and each other as they try to sail to safety.']

profile:
User Profile Summary:

- **Movie/TV Genre Preference:** The user maintains a strong affinity for classic war films, particularly WWII narratives, while also embracing high-quality productions across various genres. Their recent engagement with a mystery television series indicates a growing interest in detective stories, suggesting a willingness to explore additional narratives outside their primary preference when the quality is evident.

- **Quality Appreciation:** With a discerning taste for high-quality storytelling and exceptional filmmaking, the user's thoughtful critique style underscores their expectation for compelling narratives. Their recent positive review reflects satisfaction with a series recognized for its engaging plot and strong performances.

- **Format Preference:** The user continues to favor physical media, specifically DVD-R, aligning with their commitment to curating a film and television collection that embodies their cinematic values.

- **Actor Affinity:** While they appreciate seasoned actors, their emphasis remains on narrative strength, indicating that even strong performances cannot compensate for a weak storyline.

- **Timeliness:** The user values prompt service and efficiency in transactions, consistent with their historical patterns.

- **Engagement Style:** The user is reflective and articulate in their evaluations, offering detailed critiques. Their latest succinctly positive review confirms their ability to convey appreciation clearly while still showcasing their nuanced perspective on film and television.

Overall, the user remains a dedicated film enthusiast, expanding their horizons to include well-crafted mysteries while upholding their commitment to exceptional storytelling.
